page.title: 08FOLK CUSTOMS IN ILMINGTON
page.content: In Ilmington{May Day}has been observed as a day of celebration for a very long period.It is still maintained by the local school and it is a special day on their calendar when country dances are performed around the{ {Maypole},with all the traditional characters.In Autumn a{Harvest {Festival}is held in church and later the school has its own service.The children bring produce which is then divided between all of the old people and delivered to them.Ilmington has strong links with the{Morris dancing} world _ a local side can be traced back as far as the 17th century.There was a lull in its activities when{Sam {Bennet},a famous local dancer,died but it has since been revived and it is thriving.The dancers can often be seen performing in villages locally.
